pros: Meaningful Work with the community
cons: The pay can be low

pros: Good benefits, great students. Diversity
cons: Too much upper management. Scattered work place, no one knows who does what so helping students is almost impossible. Upper management has no idea what students need are or what they deal with just trying to register

pros: Choosing your schedule each semester provides some flexibility.
cons: Salary does not match the amount of work put in. Decisions and communication made by administration is not effective. Some co-workers contribute to a toxic work environment.

pros: The only pro is the benefits and PTO time.
cons: This place has been going downhill for years. The President is horrible and has no business being in education. I guess being a dentist wasn’t his bag neither. He fired any decent managers and hired mostly people of his own race. The IT dept is a joke and only fake brown nosers who know nothing about tech and less about management get manager / director type positions. The whole college is ruled by politics, threats and fear. Diversity and inclusion as well as civility is all preached but not practiced.

pros: Colleagues are nice, and students too.
cons: Lots of restructuring has led to low morale and uncertainty about the future. There is concern about more enrollment drops impacting job security.

review_title: Sad state of affairs in higher education
pros: Friendly employees Mostly great students
cons: As with all U.S. colleges, the primary purpose of the institution is to provide educations to students; yet at least 75% of all instructors are underpaid, part-time employees who would make more money working at Walmart.

pros: Great Environment to work here
cons: Sometimes the library is too busy

pros: Excellent teaching environment Great students Excellent staff Great academic environment
cons: Low pay for the amount of time you put into it.

pros: Great Benefits for staff and the students are great.

pros: My coworkers were nice to work with

pros: Great environment and opportunities as faculty

job_title: Military and Veterans Student Success Facilitator in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: We have a diverse body of students of all ages. You will get to make a real difference in the lives of the students you work with.
cons: Departments work in silos despite the push to work as one-college. Changes are slow.

pros: Nice people, interesting students, flexible schedule
cons: low pay, a lot of work for little money

job_title: Instructional Designer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The benefits are fantastic so it compensates the lower range in pay. The people that I worked with was very nice and collaborated very nicely. I would recommend this college. I was happy when I was there.
cons: The pay is low for the years of experience.

job_title: Daya Entry Clerk in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: PTO and holiday pay. Hours are good but no flex time.
cons: Schedule, understaffed, overworked, prepare to do your job plus the work of 2 others, terrible communication, dirty, weak union, no good leadership yet so many administrators. Absolutely no room to grow as an employee.

job_title: Employee Relations Specialist in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Best benefits ever. Great people.
cons: Salary is only problem and room to grow.

pros: Staff and students are great for the most part
cons: Too many deans of..... whatever overpaid dot appreciate worker bees

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: good benefits, good vacation, good pay
cons: There is too much overhead administration

job_title: Adjunct Professor, Psychology in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Management is excellent! Work environment is challenging but fun because of the diverse student body. Wonderful working environment!
cons: Unfortunately just like every other business that has been affected by political interests ( all full-time jobs require benefits be given to employees -  creates a system of employers parsing jobs down to the part-time level to avoid having to give benefits ), they are unable to give a full-time schedule to adjuncts, but however, work them as if they were full-time professors at a much- much lower paygrade. They are now unionized and were unionizing as I was leaving, benefits and pay may actually be better at this point.

pros: People mostly leave you alone to do your work
cons: Only certain people get promoted, extreme disloyalty to employees

pros: Great health benefits, decent wage
cons: None at this time to share

open

job_title: Senior Clerk Typist in Allegheny, PA
pros: The income is the only pro
cons: Management is lacking, no room to advance

review_title: I believe in a broken system; and a dirty one.
pros: The benefits package is amazing. Once in a while, you find a couple other positive individuals who make coming to work enjoyable. My pay is actually higher than comparable private industry jobs. I know I'm part of something bigger. ~2-3% raises each year at least for administration and SEIU employees contingent on performance or contract, respectively.
cons:
Housekeeping. Allegheny campus is an embarrassment to the city of Pittsburgh. Stained floors and walls everywhere. It honestly really bums me out about the place and will be a deciding factor on my continued employment in years to come.

Aging workforce. Thankfully, the tides are changing and a younger workforce is emerging - slowly. If only upper management would listen to the ideas of the younger workforce.

pros: In the Financial Aid department the Director and Assistant Director provided such great professional support  and development because of it you were able to grow within the college. The atmosphere was very relaxed and calm, we worked as a team and had team development opportunities and activities. The staff felt like that of a family. The Directors utilized staffs skills and strengths to better serve the department and the students. Such a great stepping stone into higher education. The pay was good enough for entry level positions and benefits were very satisfactory.
cons: I truly loved coming to work everyday because of the things I noted above and it was very hard for me to find anything wrong with College.

review_title: Want to work here because of your academic altruism
pros: A social work environment, of sorts. The atmosphere is with an air of helping people (the students) to grow and achieve.
cons: My impression of upper-level management: every once in a while, a few people in suits visited campus, or read mention of them on the website. I felt no connection to them, and saw little connection between them and the academic side of campus.

review_title: The IT Department has a Few Very Bad Apples - Otherwise it is a Great Place to Work
pros: The benefits are great and the employees believe in the mission. Leadership genuinely cares that students succeed and I've met some extremely talented and wonderful people.
cons: There are some very bad apples who are good at being bad. So, yes, DO apply to work at CCAC. Just be very careful if you are looking for a position in the ITS department.

review_title: Great benefits and work-life balance. Decent pay. Nice place to work.
pros: Benefited positions have one of the better benefits packages offered than many other Colleges/Universities in the area. Work-life balance is great and employees are given a satisifying amount of time off. Work atmosphere is good.
cons: Pay is decent, not the highest in comparison to private companies, but benefits make up for it. County and State sponsor funding is a continuing concern, but the College has rarely had layoffs as far as I can remember.

pros: Great, dedicated staff. Students who were taking advantage of their opportunity to gain an education and change their life.
cons: My manager was a tyrant and got away with bullying, intimidation, and overall poor behavior.

pros: Working in the education of our future nurses is exciting and rewarding. The job hours are flexible, part-time week days. The relationship between co-workers and lab personnel is favorable with open communication and interaction. We work as a team to promote the best learning experience possible for our students.
cons: Occasionally short staffed. The biggest con is the cap of 25 hours per week for this part-time position. Therefore, no benefits. Would love to work here full-time!

pros: I love working with the students they're great. There's some wonderful faculty and adjunct instructors.
cons: Too many administrative positions. Way too top-heavy. Don't care about the staff that work with his students on a daily basis. Too many people in positions with no knowledge of the position.

pros: I work at the West Hills Center. The staff is friendly, the work is no overly demanding or unfair. We have a great union. The pay is good and the benefits are incredible.
cons: Work gossip can be a problem, but that's why you report to administrators if there is an issue. Sometimes students/faculty/visitors can be rude or pushy, but you just have to keep a cool head.

job_title: Social Media Associate in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Hours scheduled around Class schedule, friendly staff, work on campus. Flexible job positions. +$10 an hour if you are a tutor.
cons: Some staff fail to respect student  workers. Lack of organization in admissions events, low quality advertising. Basically bottom rung.

pros:
Excellent colleagues
Lots of support
Flexible schedule
Teach not parent
cons:
Curriculum changes at each campus
Constant push to increase retention
Students go to dean about everything
Dean pushes to pass troublesome students
Adjunct scheduling is a disaster

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: it's like a small family at times
cons: they often time feel you need a degree to get paid more even with equal or more work experience if you don't have a degree you don't get paid what you're worth.

review_title: Great people - not a lot of room for advancement
pros: Great community of people; everyone is willing to help you; love my job.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity to become full-time faculty.  70% of faculty are part-time adjuncts.

pros: I received a great education at CCAC - classes are small enough to give each student the personalized experience they deserve, but large enough to get top-notch professors in the field.  I highly recommend CCAC to anyone looking for a degree.
cons: Parking at some campus lots was challenging.

review_title: CCAC Adjunct Faculty is a dream gig!
pros: Exposure to an incredibly diverse community, in age, ethnicity, nationality and more, brings classes alive and they are filled with interested students who really want to learn.
cons: Difficult, if not impossible, to move into full-time status, so you cannot support yourself with just this employment

job_title: Adjunct Professor in West Mifflin, PA
pros: All Professors are kind and helpful; we all share our thoughts and ideas about teacher.
cons:
Everything was perfect, until a new program director came in.  She only corresponds by email
The Deans only listen to all Program Directors.
Disability is not acceptable.

pros: Great community. Affordable school for students. They really allow you to work independently.
cons: Students are admitted indiscriminately so many are not college ready. That can present quite a challenge.

pros: Touching minds and lives and opening them to possibilities.  Academic Freedom, Autonomy in the classroom.  Friendly faculty and staff and administration.
cons: Not enough opportunity to advance.  Difficult to become full-time and lack of benefits.

review_title: Awful don't apply run for your life.
pros: The students were great eager to learn.
cons:
Lack of respect for adjunct instructors. 
One department head sending constant emails with immediate demands during off duty hours.
Human resources does not follow up on complaints. 
HR will use retaliation  to intimidate  you if report  abusive behavior. Dea

pros: Students are great and love the work more than hate it.
cons: Administration aren't so lovely to work with.

review_title: Great place to work and gain experience

pros: I worked as an instructor for continuing education classes. The work was flexible and the other staff was very helpful.
cons: The work was part-time and hours were not guaranteed.

job_title: Help Desk Support in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: They are very supportive and they will train you. They always there for you.
cons: I don’t have any cons, working there was the best thing that could happen to me.

review_title: Good as long as it's a temporary job
pros: friendly people, interesting job (if you like it), fair pay, good as a temporary job
cons: only part-time, no raise, no benefits, no growth

review_title: Good place to work and close to home
pros: Great people, adequate time off, fun customer base, low stress
cons: Unable to move much within the company

pros: Good environement, easy to work with colleagues, lots of independance.
